questions.question: Which theory does this diagram illustrate?
Who developed this model to support Aristotle's theory of the universe?
How did Aristotle explain the way that objects in the Universe move?

choices.answer: elliptical orbits in spheres with Earth at the center
circles on one giant sphere with Earth at the center
elliptical orbits on one giant sphere with Sun at the center
circles on small spheres in large spheres w/Earth at center

questions.question: How does Aristarchus' view of the Solar System compare with Aristotle's view?

choices.answer: Their theories do not differ, because both are geocentric.
Their theories do not differ, because both are heliocentric.
Aristarchus'  is geocentric, Aristotle's is heliocentric.
Aristarchus' is heliocentric, Aristotle's is geocentric.

questions.question: How did Aristotle explain that no parallax was observed when viewing the stars?

choices.answer: The stars are very far away.
Parallax is undetectable to the eye.
Viewers need to move to observe parallax.

questions.question: How does Ptolemy's model of the universe compare with Aristotle's model?

choices.answer: Both models are based on parallax.
Both models show celestial objects have circular paths.
Both models show celestial objects have elliptical paths.

questions.question: According to Kepler's laws, how do planets move in the Solar System?
What did Galileo's observations of Jupiter's moons show?

choices.answer: All celestial bodies orbited the sun.
Planets other than Earth had bodies moving around them.

questions.question: What did Galileo conclude from his observations of Venus?

choices.answer: It is farther from the sun than Earth is.
It has moons and the moons have phases.

questions.question: Which statement is not part of Copernicus' theory of the Solar System?

choices.answer: Planets orbit the sun in elliptical orbits.
Earth rotates on its axis, causing day and night.
Earth revolves around the sun, causing seasons.

questions.question: What is gravity?

choices.answer: a force of attraction between objects due to their masses
unbalanced force that makes objects move in elliptical path
rotating cloud of gas and dust from which solar system forms
point in the orbit at which planet is furthest from the sun

questions.question: Which term describes a force of attraction between two objects that results from their masses?
Which of these choices states Newton's law of Universal gravitation?

choices.answer: As a planet orbits, it covers equal areas in equal time.
The orbit of the planet is an ellipse w/sun at one focus.
Gravity increases as mass increases or distance decreases.

questions.question: What did Lee's calculation's demonstrate?
Which term best describes the shape of the orbits of planets in our solar system?
The distance between Mercury and the sun is 0.387 AU. What is the orbital period of Mercury?
Which description would be used to explain the solar nebula?

choices.answer: rotation cloud of dust and gas
disk of material surrounding a young star
small body from which a planet originates
rocky core surrounded by a deep atmosphere of gas and ice

questions.question: Which term describes a small body from which a planet forms?
What role did gravity play in the formation of the sun?

choices.answer: Caused protoplanetary disk to rotate and become planetesimal
Caused protoplanetary disk to rotate and form solar nebula
Caused solar nebula to collapse toward center
Caused small particles to collide to form planetesimals

questions.question: Eric is creating a timeline of solar system formation.  Which best describes the formation?
